metadata.title: CVE-2022-0284 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
[Unknown description]

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2022-0284` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 7.x only
imagemagick-6-common - 7.x only
imagemagick-6.q16 - 7.x only
imagemagick-6.q16hdri - 7.x only
imagemagick-common - 7.x only
libimage-magick-perl - 7.x only
libimage-magick-q16-perl - 7.x only
libimage-magick-q16hdri-perl - 7.x only
libmagick++-6-headers - 7.x only
libmagick++-6.q16-8 - 7.x only
libmagick++-6.q16hdri-8 - 7.x only
libmagickcore-6-arch-config - 7.x only
libmagickcore-6-headers - 7.x only
libmagickcore-6.q16-6 - 7.x only
libmagickcore-6.q16-6-extra - 7.x only
libmagickcore-6.q16hdri-6 - 7.x only
libmagickcore-6.q16hdri-6-extra - 7.x only
libmagickwand-6-headers - 7.x only
libmagickwand-6.q16-6 - 7.x only
libmagickwand-6.q16hdri-6 - 7.x only
perlmagick - 7.x only
No subscription required

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.x only').
